trackTitle: ISC Class 11 Computer Science Complete Roadmap
description: A complete ISC Class 11 Computer Science learning roadmap covering hardware fundamentals, propositional logic, Java programming, algorithms, data structures, input-output, recursion, ethical issues and practical projects as prescribed by CISCE.

institute.name: Coder & AccoTax
institute.author: Sukanta Hui
institute.trackType: ISC Class 11 Computer Science Tutorial Roadmap

subject: Computer Science

segments.title: Section A – Basic Computer Hardware and Software
segments.summary: Understand number systems, positional logic, propositional logic, computer architecture and hardware fundamentals.

modules.title: Numbers and Number Systems
topics: Representation of numbers in different bases
Interconversion between binary, octal, decimal and hexadecimal
Addition and subtraction in different bases
Positional number system and base
1's and 2's complement
Use of complements in arithmetic
Algorithms for base conversion
learningOutcomes: Convert numbers between different number systems
Perform arithmetic operations in different bases
modules.summary: Master number representation and conversions as required in ISC examinations.

modules.title: Positional (Propositional) Logic – Fundamentals
topics: Meaning and definition of a proposition
Difference between proposition and non-proposition (commands, questions, exclamations)
Simple propositions and compound propositions
Propositional variables and symbolic representation (p, q, r...)
Well-Formed Formula (WFF) – meaning, syntax rules and examples
Truth values – True and False
Basic logical connectives – NOT (¬), AND (∧), OR (∨)
Negation of a proposition and common mistakes
Conjunction and disjunction – real life examples
Truth tables for NOT, AND and OR
Formation of compound statements using logical connectives
Translation of English statements into symbolic form
Translation of symbolic form into English statements
Identification of propositions in a paragraph
Common logical symbols and their meanings
Word problems based on propositions
Introduction to tautology and contradiction (conceptual)
Introduction to logical equivalence (conceptual)
Common errors in forming propositions
Practice set on truth value evaluation
Revision & Mixed Practice on Propositional Logic
Practice your Skill
learningOutcomes: Find truth values of basic compound propositions
modules.summary: Learn how logical statements are formed and evaluated using positional logic.

modules.title: Propositional Logic, Logic Gates & Arithmetic Circuits
topics: Truth tables for compound propositions
Tautology, contradiction and equivalence
Implication and bi-conditional
Logic gates: AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, XNOR
Half adder and full adder
Hardware implementation of arithmetic operations
Use of 2's complement in arithmetic
learningOutcomes: Construct truth tables for logical expressions
Understand hardware circuits for binary arithmetic
modules.summary: Learn the foundation of logical reasoning and its hardware implementation.

segments.title: Section B – Java Programming & Algorithms
segments.summary: Develop programming skills in Java including OOP concepts, arrays, methods and recursion.

modules.title: Object Oriented Programming using Java
topics: Objects and classes
Instance and class difference
Java Virtual Machine
Compile time and run time errors
try, catch, throw, throws and finally
User defined exceptions
learningOutcomes: Create simple Java classes and objects
modules.summary: Start programming in Java using object oriented principles.
